title: Felicity Huffman and William H. Macy step out ahead of her prison stint for college scandal
text:
She'll soon serve prison time for her part in the college admission scandal.

But Felicity Huffman and William H. Macy were intent on enjoying some time together while supporting The Rape Foundation at its annual brunch on Saturday afternoon in Los Angeles.

The 56-year-old actress donned a gorgeous cream coat paired with an all-black ensemble as she stood by her husband of more than 20 years at the charitable event despite the difficult time in her life.

Love: Felicity Huffman and William H. Macy were intent on enjoying some time together while supporting The Rape Foundation at its annual brunch on Saturday afternoon in Los Angeles

Felicity looked chic in a plush black turtleneck and slim black slacks paired with matching loafers.

She wore her dark blonde hair slightly curled with fringe framing her face, and kept a pair of dark shades over her eyes.

William showed off his dapper style while sporting a navy blue blazer with matching slacks and a polka dot shirt.

Support: The 56-year-old actress donned a gorgeous cream coat paired with an all-black ensemble as she stood by her husband of more than 20 years at the charitable event despite the difficult time in her life

His shaggy auburn hair was worn tousled to the side and he showed off a salt-and-pepper hued beard to match a mustache.

The family have put on a united front since Felicity pleaded guilty for her involvement in the Operation Varsity Blues scandal.

The Desperate Housewives star paid $15,000 to have her daughter Sophia's SAT test scores altered.

Taking flight: William was spotted at Los Angeles International Airport on Sunday

Traveler: His shaggy auburn hair was worn tousled to the side and he showed off a salt-and-pepper hued beard to match a mustache

Felicity was sentenced to 14 days in prison, a year of supervised release and a $30,000 fine after pleading guilty for her involvement in the scandal.

She will also have to serve 250 hours of community service as part of her plea, but making sure she gains back the respect from her family is a priority for the mother-of-two

'There is much to be done, and some of the hurt and anger will take years to work through, but we are making progress,' her husband William H. Macy wrote in a letter to the court.

Huffman is set to report to the Federal Correctional Institution in Dublin, California on Oct. 25.
